title.narrative: Regional African Workshop on Bringing Agenda 2030 to Life

description.narrative:
CAFOD and Caritas Africa are organising a workshop to share lessons on how to do research-based advocacy at national level. UCL will provide the methodology and part of the facilitation and CAFOD partners from Kenya, Sierra Leone, Liberia and Zambia will provide key input. The workshop will showcase a participatory research conducted by UCL and CAFOD together with four national CAFOD partners in Kenya, Liberia, Sierra Leone and Zambia. Responding to a request by Caritas Africa, the aim of this workshop is to provide a platform for learning and reflection for other national Caritas organisations in Africa on how to engage effectively with governments around the SDGs.
The participatory research that will be used as a foundation for this workshop aims at unpacking transformational principles embedded in Agenda 2030 and translate them into policy recommendations for partners to use when engaging with national governments. These principles are also strongly correlated with elements included in Laudato Si’. Given that the participants of this workshop will be all Catholic agencies, the discussions will also focus on exploring the link between development and faith further.
